summaries.body: The annual Draconid meteor shower peaks Thursday night and is likely to be helped by good visibility across much of the U.S. and a waning crescent moon.
North Charleston, S.C., announced a $6.5 million settlement with the family of Walter L. Scott, a black man who was fatally shot as he fled a white police officer.
An Indiana University fraternity was shut down after a cellphone video surfaced that showed members watching and cheering while a fellow member performed a sex act.
Knicks Coach Derek Fisher spoke briefly about published reports that Matt Barnes, a former teammate, had confronted him at the home of Barnes’s estranged wife.
A new study says children living near the Fukushima nuclear meltdowns have been diagnosed with thyroid cancer at a rate 20 to 50 times that of children elsewhere.

display_asset.caption: The Shanmukhananda Hall in Mumbai, where a concert by the Pakistani singer, Ghulam Ali, was to have been held on Friday.

summaries.body: Two concerts by a veteran Pakistani singer in the Indian state of Maharashtra were canceled by the organizers after a Hindu right-wing party took exception to the events.
Lionel Messi, the star of F.C. Barcelona, is to appear in court with his father to face tax fraud charges related to past advertising contracts. A trial date has not yet been set.

display_asset.caption: The winner of the 2015 Nobel Peace Prize will be announced in this room in Oslo on Friday.

summaries.body: British gamblers are betting on who will win the Nobel Peace Prize, with the odds favoring Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany. The prize will be announced on Friday.

display_asset.caption: The skeleton of a man found in the Mota cave in Ethiopia yielded the first complete assemblage of DNA retrieved from an ancient human in Africa.

summaries.body: Scientists said they recovered the genome from a 4,500-year-old human skeleton in Ethiopia, the first time a complete assemblage of DNA has been retrieved from an ancient human in Africa.

display_asset.caption: A virtual brain slice. The Blue Brain Project built a reconstruction of a section of rat brain in a computer, and hopes to do the same with a human brain eventually.

summaries.body: Building on years of study, 82 researchers from institutions around the world reported that they have built a reconstruction of a section of rat brain in a computer.
Airman First Class Spencer Stone, one of the three men who foiled a terrorist attack on a Paris-bound train in August, was stabbed in Sacramento, an official said.

display_asset.caption: President Obama spoke to labor leaders and activists in the East Room of the White House this week.

summaries.body: Rupert Murdoch, the executive chairman of News Corporation, was under fire for suggesting that President Obama is not a “real black president.” He later apologized.

display_asset.credit: XL Catlin Seaview Survey, via Associated Press

summaries.body: Scientists say widespread coral bleaching, caused by unusually warm waters that strip away protective algae, could kill 5 percent of the world’s corals this year.
Amid growing scrutiny of Greek life at colleges across the U.S., a fraternity at Indiana University has been suspended and faces an investigation after accounts of hazing.
After judges of the "Great British Bake Off" crowned a winner, the final episode became the year's most-watched program in Britain.
A new study says children living near the Fukushima nuclear plant in Japan have been diagnosed with thyroid cancer at a rate 20 to 50 times that of children elsewhere.
Airstrikes by a military coalition led by Saudi Arabia hit a house south of Yemen's capital, killing at least 23 people who were attending a wedding party, said witnesses.

display_asset.caption: A screenshot from the website of Norbert Baksa, a Hungarian photographer, showing a model playing a migrant taking a selfie.

summaries.body: A Hungarian fashion photographer has faced a fierce backlash after using the backdrop of the migrant crisis to display luxury clothing brands, calling it “migrant chic.”
Pope Francis is facing an uproar after he called people in a Chilean city “dumb” for protesting against a bishop accused of complicity in clerical sexual abuse.
Gannett, the owner of USA Today, said it agreed to buy Journal Media Group, owner of The Milwaukee Journal Sentinel and 14 other dailies, for about $280 million.
A California jury found Matthew Keys, a former deputy social media editor at Reuters, guilty of three felonies in relation to a 2010 incident of online vandalism.

posts.footer: The New York Times and The Associated Press

display_asset.caption: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia celebrated his 63rd birthday by teaming with N.H.L. legends to play hockey against Russian tycoons and officials. Putin scored seven goals as his team won, 15-10.
display_asset.credit: Produced by By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

sectionFrontImages.credit: Pool photo by Alexey Nikolsky - Ria Novosti / Kremlin

display_asset.title: Putin’s Hockey Party for His Birthday

summaries.body: Vladimir Putin celebrated his 63rd birthday with another show of physical prowess. The Russian leader led a hockey team to a 15-10 victory, scoring seven goals himself.

display_asset.caption: Roll call in the Bronx. Recent incidents of police officers facing denials of service have generated attention on social media.

summaries.body: Recent incidents of police officers facing denials of service at chain restaurants have generated attention on social media.

display_asset.caption: Agriculture Secretary Tom Vilsack during testimony on Wednesday before the House Committee on Agriculture.

summaries.body: A House hearing on dietary guidelines highlighted worries over the influence of special interest groups, environmental concerns and private sector bias.
“Man in Polyester Suit,” a photograph by Robert Mapplethorpe that was once denounced in Congress as obscene, sold at auction for $478,000.

display_asset.caption: The ESPN analyst Jessica Mendoza during the College World Series in Omaha in June.

summaries.body: Jessica Mendoza's groundbreaking moment as the first woman to call a major-league baseball postseason game ended up showing how sexism persists in sports.

display_asset.caption: Any merger of the brewing giants Anheuser-Busch InBev and SABMiller would be closely scrutinized by regulators.

summaries.body: SABMiller rejected an increased bid from Anheuser-Busch, saying the $104 billion offer still undervalued the company.
Should Americans eat more fat? The secretaries of agriculture and health testified before a House committee on proposed, contentious new U.S. dietary guidelines.

An Associated Press investigation revealed that the authorities working with the F.B.I. had foiled several plots by gangs thought to have Russian ties as they tried to sell radioactive material to Middle Eastern extremists.
LinkedIn agreed to pay $13 million to settle a lawsuit that accused the social network of sending too many emails to potential connections without members' consent.
